newsitem.title: CHINA: China plans $1.8 bln petrochemical investment.
newsitem.headline: China plans $1.8 bln petrochemical investment.

text.p: China plans to invest 15.5 billion yuan ($1.8 billion) in northwestern Qinghai province to set up several petrochemical plants in the next five years, the Xinhua news agency said on Friday.

The second stage of a potash fertiliser plant in Golmud city in Qinghai's Qaidam basin would be completed within the five-year period and the plant was expected to produce 800,000 tonnes of potash a year, it said.
A polyvinyl chloride plant with a designed annual production capacity of 120,000 tonnes and a urea plant with production capacity of 180,000 tonnes would also be built, it said.
In Golmud, the Qarhan salt lake with more than 60 billion tons of soluble salt has China's largest potassium and magnesium ore field, Xinhua said.
Qinghai has verified 50 billion cubic metres of natural gas in Sebei natural gas field, and there was still potential for more natural resources exploration, it said.
